  • SimpleModule

Namespace SimpleModule

Presentation

SimpleModule is an example included in the pipeline flux-pack of YouWol. Its purpose is to provide an example of simple module in Flux that can be duplicated or updated.

The module combines two numbers from an incoming message either using addition or multiplication (see implementation here). It features:

  • one input, expected to get two numbers (or numbers compatible as defined by permissiveNumber). Input are defined using the method addInput
  • a rendering view, to display the results of the operation each time one is computed, or a default invite if no result have been computed yet
  • an output stream, emitting the results for further use in your application. Output are added using addOutput
  • a persistent data, to save the operation's type within your application

Resources

Various resources:

  • flux-core documentation: the place to go to learn more about designing modules for flux
  • YouWol website: the YouWol project presentation

Variables

Let operationsFactory

operationsFactory: { addition: (d: [number, number]) => number; multiplication: (d: [number, number]) => number } = ...
  • Defined in src/lib/simple-module.module.ts:59

The operations factory links the enum Operations to their actual implementation:

let operationsFactory = {
     [Operations.ADDITION] : (d: [number, number]) => d[0] + d[1],
     [Operations.MULTIPLICATION] : (d: [number, number]) => d[0] * d[1],
}

        Returns number

  • multiplication: (d: [number, number]) => number
      • (d: [number, number]): number

      • Parameters

        Returns number

Let permissiveNumber

permissiveNumber: AnyOf<number> = ...
  • Defined in src/lib/simple-module.module.ts:122

This is a building block of the contract associated to the module's input.

A permissiveNumber is either:

  • a straight number
  • an object of type {value: number}

See straightNumber

To learn more about contract: contract documentation

Let straightNumber

straightNumber: BaseExpectation<number> = ...
  • Defined in src/lib/simple-module.module.ts:105

This is a building block of the contract associated to the module's input: an expectation fulfilled only if the incoming data is a number (inputData) => typeof (inputData) == 'number' See permissiveNumber

To learn more about contract: contract documentation

renderHtmlElement

  • renderHtmlElement(mdle: Module): HTMLElement
    • Defined in src/lib/simple-module.module.ts:199

    This function defines how to render the module in the rendering-panel.

    To learn more:

    • @RenderView decorator
    • flux-view

    Note: You can use any of your favorite framework to render the view, flux-view is what we use @ YouWol.

    Parameters

    • mdle: Module

    Returns HTMLElement
